propositions.text: The story begins on a winter night at Fenglingdu on the Yellow River in Shanxi.
A man leaves an infant at the doorstep of an old house.
The infant is found by an old man named Guo.
The man who left the infant disappears into the Yellow River.
The story then shifts to Jiangnan in March, in the village of Wuyuan in Jiangxi.
Two men from the Pinkerton Private Detective Agency arrive at the Nanshan Rural Hospital.
They inform the hospital director, Zhu Hansheng, that they have concluded their six-year search for the missing girl, Zu Mo.
Their investigation suggests Zu Mo may have died six years prior.
They mention finding a Thai grand master, Monrachawong. Kunba, who last saw Zu Mo.
Hansheng's adopted son, Shen Caihua, believes Zu Mo is still alive.
Caihua has a unique characteristic of spitting, which he remembers as a trait of Zu Mo.
Hansheng and his father-in-law, Wu Chushanren, plan to travel to Yunnan to search for Zu Mo.
Wu Chushanren suggests that Zu Mo might be hidden in China, as foreigners would have difficulty navigating the system.
He also points to the border region between Myanmar and Yunnan as a potential location.
Caihua, with his parrot Dudu, decides to find Zu Mo himself.
Dudu, an intelligent and learned macaw, secretly teaches Caihua and offers advice.
Caihua and Dudu plan to seek help from a mysterious figure known as 'Ling Ge' in Hukou County.
Ling Ge is rumored to be a spirit inside a deceased boy who can predict the future.
Caihua and Dudu embark on their journey to Hukou.
They hitch a ride on a truck carrying pigs.
Upon arrival at Stone Bell Mountain, Caihua and Dudu encounter police and curious onlookers gathered at the house where Ling Ge resides.
Caihua's unusual parrot draws significant attention.
Inside the house, experts debate the nature of Ling Ge, with some espousing materialistic views and others embracing scientific possibilities.
Caihua attempts to communicate with Ling Ge to ask about Zu Mo.
Ling Ge responds, but enigmatically.
The authorities decide to dissect the boy's body to extract Ling Ge.
A ritual is performed by Daoist priest Fei Ziyun before the dissection.
During the dissection, a small figure emerges from a tumor in the boy's abdomen.
The emergence of this figure triggers a condition known as 'koro' (缩阳症) among the onlookers.
The small figure, identified as a 'Fengzi Gui' (枫子鬼) or 'Ling Ge', escapes.
The blind fortune teller reveals information about Fengzi Gui, explaining they are 'ghost immortals' that can inhabit human bodies.
The fortune teller's true motive is to capture Fengzi Gui, having already captured 'Ling Jie'.
Meanwhile, a lavish dinner is being prepared for the experts and local officials, featuring a giant fish head from Poyang Lake.
The county magistrate elaborates on the cultural significance and culinary aspects of the fish head.
The conversation at dinner turns to Ling Ge's ability to help solve past criminal cases.
Yu Lao, an elder, expresses skepticism about Ling Ge's abilities, attributing them to technology rather than supernatural phenomena.

concepts.name: Fenglingdu

concepts.name: Zu Mo
concepts.context: The missing girl whose whereabouts are being sought throughout the story.

concepts.name: Monrachawong. Kunba
concepts.context: A Thai grand master who was the last person to see Zu Mo.

concepts.name: Pinkerton Private Detective Agency
concepts.context: An organization hired to investigate Zu Mo's disappearance.

concepts.name: Zhu Hansheng
concepts.context: Director of Nanshan Rural Hospital and caretaker of Zu Mo's case.

concepts.name: Shen Caihua
concepts.context: Hansheng's adopted son who is determined to find Zu Mo.

concepts.name: Dudu
concepts.context: Caihua's intelligent and talking macaw, who aids him in his quest.

concepts.name: Ling Ge
concepts.context: A mysterious entity residing within a deceased boy, capable of predicting the future.

concepts.name: Hukou County
concepts.context: The location where Ling Ge is found and where Caihua seeks information.

concepts.name: Stone Bell Mountain
concepts.context: The specific location in Hukou County where the Ling Ge phenomenon occurs.

concepts.name: Fengzi Gui
concepts.context: A type of 'ghost immortal' identified as Ling Ge, originating from maple tree galls.

concepts.name: Koro (缩阳症)
concepts.context: A psychological condition causing genital retraction, triggered by the emergence of Ling Ge.

concepts.name: Fei Ziyun
concepts.context: A Daoist priest and researcher of human potential, involved in the investigation of Ling Ge.

concepts.name: Yu Lao
concepts.context: An elder who adheres to materialistic scientific principles and is skeptical of supernatural phenomena.

concepts.name: Monrachawong. Bing
concepts.context: Mentioned as the person who abducted Zu Mo from the jungle in Myanmar.

hierarchy.structure: The document follows a narrative structure, starting with an inciting incident in the past, then moving to the present investigation, the development of a new lead (Ling Ge), and the subsequent unfolding of events and debates surrounding this phenomenon. It is divided into chapters, indicating a serialized or novelistic format.
